units.title: Passaging hiPS cell colonies
units.text: To passage hiPS cell colonies, cells were incubated with 0.5 mM EDTA for 7 min at room temperature, resuspended in Essential 8 medium and distributed into new six-well plates.
units.rationale: Describes the routine passage step for maintaining hiPS cell cultures.

units.title: Preparation for lentiviral infection
units.text: CAG::Cas9;Dlxi1/2::eGFP hiPS cells were passaged with accutase 1 day before infection with the lentiviral library (with 5 µg ml−1 polybrene).
units.rationale: Specifies the timing and conditions for preparing cells for lentiviral transduction.

units.title: FACS selection of transduced cells
units.text: Three days later, mCherry+ cells were selected by FACS (collected roughly 3.6 × 10^6 cells) and seeded onto vitronectin coated plates to recover and expand for another 6 days.
units.rationale: Outlines the enrichment of successfully transduced cells by flow cytometry.

units.title: Generation of SMAD4 HET hiPS cells – fixation and staining
units.text: SMAD4 HET hiPS cells were fixed overnight with 4% paraformaldehyde (PFA) at 4 °C. The next day, samples were washed with PBS (2 h × 3, 37 °C) before incubation in a nuclear staining solution (1:150 dilution of RedDot Biotium 40061-T) in PBS with 500 mM NaCl at 37 °C overnight.
units.rationale: Provides the fixation and nuclear staining protocol for creating heterozygous SMAD4 lines.

units.title: Organoid dissociation with papain
units.text: Organoids were dissociated with an enzyme solution containing 10 U ml−1 papain (Worthington, catalogue no. LS003127) at 37 °C for 15 min; this solution was prewarmed.
units.rationale: Details the enzymatic dissociation step required to obtain single‑cell suspensions from organoids.

units.title: Live imaging of Dlxi1/2b::eGFP+ cell migration
units.text: To image the Dlxi1/2b::eGFP+ cell migration, hFA were transferred to a well of a 96-well plate with a clear bottom (ibidi, catalogue no. 89626) in 500 µl of neural medium under environmentally controlled conditions (37 °C, 5% CO2) for 30–60 min.
units.rationale: Specifies the setup for time‑lapse imaging of migrating interneurons.

units.title: Preparation of whole‑cell lysates for western blot
units.text: Whole cell protein lysates were prepared using the RIPA buffer system. 50 µl of SDS buffer was added to two spheres in a 1.5 ml tube. Samples were sonicated for a total of 7–9 s using an ultrasonicator (Qsonica Q500 sonicator; pulse 3 s on, 3 s off; amplitude 20%).
units.rationale: Describes the lysis and sonication steps needed to extract protein for SDS‑PAGE.

units.title: Flow cytometry sorting of reporter‑positive cells
units.text: To sort mCherry+ or GFP+ cells during the screen, FACS was conducted (Santa Cruz, catalogue no. sc-24948) on BD-Aria II instruments (Stanford FACS Facility).
units.rationale: Provides the instrument and reagent details for sorting fluorescent reporter cells.

units.title: Real‑time qPCR workflow
units.text: For real-time qPCR analysis, mRNA was isolated using the RNeasy Mini Plus kit (Qiagen, catalogue no. 74136) and template complimentary DNA was prepared by reverse transcription using the SuperScript III First-Strand Synthesis System (Thermo Fisher Scientific, catalogue no. 4312704). Real-time qPCR was performed using the SYBR Green PCR Master Mix (Thermo Fisher Scientific, catalogue no. 4312704) on a QuantStudio 6 Flex Real-Time PCR System (Thermo Fisher Scientific, catalogue no. 4312704).
units.rationale: Summarizes the extraction, cDNA synthesis, and amplification steps for gene expression quantification.

units.title: Immunofluorescence staining of organoid sections
units.text: For immunofluorescence staining, cryosections were blocked in 10% normal donkey serum (MilliporeSigma, catalogue no. S30-M) and 0.3% Triton X-100 (MilliporeSigma, catalogue no. T9284-100ML) diluted in PBS for 1 h at room temperature. Sections were then incubated overnight at 4 °C with primary antibodies diluted in PBS containing 10% NDS and 0.3% Triton X-100.
units.rationale: Outlines the blocking and primary antibody incubation steps for fluorescent labeling of tissue sections.
